Randomization-based testing for equal means in two groups

Randomization-based testing for equal means in two groups

testByRandomization(X, B, flavor = c("perm", "flip"), cls = NULL,
  p.value = TRUE, seed = NULL)

Arguments

X

a matrix of m variables by n observations
B

A numeric value, the number of permutations to be performed
flavor

A character value, the type of randomization to be performed. Should either be "perm" for two-sample permutation or "flip" for sign flipping
cls

A vector of length n class labels in 0,1 for flavor "perm". Defaults to NULL
p.value

A boolean value: should \(p\)-values be calculated and returned? Defaults to @TRUE
seed

An integer (or NULL) value used as a seed for random number generation. If NULL, no seed is specified

Value

a list with two or four elements:

T

A vector of \(m\) test statistics

T0

A \(m \times B\) matrix of permutation test statistics

p

A vector of \(m\) \(p\)-values (only if p.value is @TRUE)

p0

A \(m \times B\) matrix of permutation \(p\)-values (ony if p.value is @TRUE)

Details

The test statistics is Welch's two-sample test for unequal variances

References

Ge, Y., Dudoit, S. and Speed, T.P., 2003. Resampling-based multiple testing for microarray data analysis. _Test_, 12(1), pp.1-77.

Examples


p <- 513
n <- 38
mat <- matrix(rnorm(p*n), ncol=n)
cls <- rep(c(0, 1), times=c(27, n-27))
resPerm <- testByRandomization(X=mat, flavor="perm", cls=cls, B=1000)
resFlip <- testByRandomization(X=mat, flavor="flip", B=1000)

# show test statistics null distribution
hist(resPerm$p)
hist(resFlip$p)

alpha <- 0.05
resP <- jointFWERControl(resPerm$T0, refFamily="Simes", alpha=alpha, stat=resPerm$T)
#> [1] "Joint Family-Wise Error Rate control: Step down procedure based on Simes family"
resF <- jointFWERControl(resFlip$T0, refFamily="Simes", alpha=alpha, stat=resFlip$T)
#> [1] "Joint Family-Wise Error Rate control: Step down procedure based on Simes family"
